alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 7:16PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wake County through 800 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near RDU International, or near Raleigh, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Wake Forest, RDU International, Morrisville, Rolesville, Falls Lake Boat Ramp, Purnell, William B Umstead State Park and Falls Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Boaters on Falls Lake and those camping outdoors are especially vulnerable to the dangers of lightning. Seek harbor immediately and find safe shelter in a nearby building or vehicle.
